column4: hi, where can i set up some advanced sound options? my bass is to great
it's also somewhere in system menus, but do alt+f2 and run it
hm you can only adjust volume there ;(
ok, check system > preferences > sound maybe that gives options; also you can set there what volumes you wish to control with volume-control iirc
hm i know all these... i was hoping there was something more advanced.. you have to know that i own a X-FI soundcard ;)
eh how do i find out? i just konw that i have installed the proprietary creative drivers which are kinda new
then it's the default ubuntu sound, which is pulse. Too bad, I had a alsa-config in which you could dim bass
you know good drivers for my x-fi? ;)
try to find a pulse audio config file in which you can tweak stuff
i guess x-fi only works with the ones from crreative
not really, there are sites for that
when i open the volume manager i can choose the device, that it says "Creative X-FI (Alsa Mixer)
alsa is a different way to manage sound in ubuntu, some prefer that; there is also oss but pulse-audio is default
to switch to another is a bit complex, I don't want to screw your box
hm i think i'll try to fix this by hardware
